attributes.additional_details:
Government statistics categorise 85,000 households (which may contain more than one person) as homeless.

Nearly 10,000 people sleep on the streets every night.

It would take less than 0.005% of the UK's GDP to bring all empty, abandoned and derelict housing up to code.

I would like the government to commit to ending domestic homelessness by funding the renovation of existing houses to provide accommodation to those who have none.
